Emperor Wu the Filial was Emperor Jing's middle son, with Consort Wang as his mother. At age four he was established as King of Jiaodong. At age seven he became crown prince, and his mother became empress. At age fourteen, he first ascended the throne when Emperor Jing passed away. On the day Dinghai, the emperor ascended the throne and honored the empress as Empress Dowager. First year, winter, tenth month, Chancellor Dou Ying became Grandee Secretary.

Spring, first month, Chancellor Dou Ying was dismissed. Summer, fourth month, earthquake. Granted amnesty to the world.

Appraisal: The Han dynasty inherited the decline of a hundred kings. Gaozu eliminated chaos and restored proper order; Emperors Wen and Jing devoted themselves to nourishing the people, but in matters of investigating ancient rites and culture, there were still many deficiencies. When Emperor Wu first ascended the throne, he outstandingly dismissed and rejected the hundred schools of thought, honoring and exalting the six classics. He then surveyed the realm within the four seas, raised their outstanding talents, and established great achievements with them. This passage continues the historical record of Emperor Wu's transformative reign during the Han dynasty.
